alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 12:25AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following county, Anderson. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Garnett, Greeley and Garnett Airport.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
